titleStmt.title: William Alexander to James W. Tate
CWG2368

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Brandenburg Nov 30th 1860
Jas W Tate Esqr
Dr Sir

Yours of the 27th is before me I wrote the Govnr in a hurry just as our Sheriff was starting for Frankfort, and entirely forgot to state the names of the resigning Magistrates, & No of District. I will now do so, District No 5 Enos Keith & Jas F Overton, the magistrates resignd, I understand Mr Overton will accept at the request of his neighbors if reappointed his resignation has been accepted by the court. and so stands on the record. You will therefore please Send Commissions for him & Henry Boohen, to fill the vacancy in District No 5,
